intro: Urostigma schiedeanum, commonly known as the Schiedea's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Urostigma schiedeanum is considered a rare and endangered species.
